title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: At futuristic meeting, AIs took the lead in producing and reviewing all the studies
items.description: Organizers aim to tune AI to help accelerate science

items.title: Can the Deadliest Catch crab fishery survive warming seas?
items.description: After a brutal heat wave, scientists race to predict how Bering Sea snow crabs will cope with climate change

items.title: University of California faculty push back against Big Brother cybersecurity mandate
items.description: School officials defend software as bulwark against ransomware, but professors fear potential surveillance of their devices

items.title: Fat-chomping enzyme that ‘moonlights’ as gene regulator could point to obesity treatments
items.description: Hormone-sensitive lipase works in the nucleus to keep fat cells healthy, new study suggests

items.title: New recipe improves creation of cells that could fight most autoimmune diseases
items.description: Nobel laureate makes regulatory T cells that last longer in the body, boosting clinical hopes

items.title: Sumerian civilization may have been jump-started by the rise and fall of tides
items.description: Millennia before the first cities, early Mesopotamians probably harnessed tides to irrigate crops

items.title: ‘I fear we are sitting on a time bomb.’ Scientists debate mass distribution of antibiotics in Africa
items.description: Prophylactic use of azithromycin saves vulnerable children’s lives, but could trigger antibiotic resistance

items.title: ‘It’s like a horror movie pregnancy.’ Researcher studies maggots—by letting them eat him
items.description: <cite>Science</cite> chats with wildlife epidemiologist Tony Goldberg about what he’s learned from becoming a meal for parasites

items.title: A surprise bonus from COVID-19 vaccines: bolstering cancer treatment
items.description: Patients who got shots of mRNA before starting a type of cancer immunotherapy lived much longer

items.title: Stranded coral boulders point to a medieval tsunami in the Caribbean
items.description: Study pinpoints likely date for a massive earthquake on the Puerto Rico Trench—and highlights an underappreciated regional hazard
